com.yahoo.bullet.storm.batching

Class BatchManager<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.bullet.storm.batching.BatchManager<T>

  • public class BatchManager<T>
extends Object
    Objects in the batch manager are partitioned by key and then batched randomly within each partition. The number of partitions and the batch size can be specified. Note that batch size is used to determine the max/min capacity of a partition and when a partition needs to be resized. It is not a guarantee on the max size of a batch. The batch manager supports GZIP compression. Batches are only compressed when partitions are resized or when the compressed batches are retrieved, in which case only changed batches will be re-compressed. Batches can be retrieved both partitioned and non-partitioned. These batches are separate data structures and do not reflect changes to the batch manager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatchManager

        public BatchManager(int batchSize,
                    int partitionCount,
                    boolean batchCompressEnable)
        Creates a BatchManager with the given batch size and partition count.
        Parameters:
        batchSize - The approximate maximum number of elements in a batch.
        partitionCount - The number of partitions to use.
        batchCompressEnable - Whether or not to serialize and compress batches.
